title: LOL Install unknown error
body:
Hi all, 
I am trying to reinstall LOL after a complete uninstallation of EVERYTHING to do with LOL including launcher and patcher. When I click 'download the game' on the League of legends website it asks to make changes to the hard drive I allow it and then it opens the league of legends installer. I proceed to click next then agree to the terms and conditions, click next again it begins installing LOL and gets right up to unpacking files and then spews out the following error code: 
"There has been an error.
Unknow error unpacking file C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/projects/League_client/releases/installer/deploy/libcef.dll
The application will exit now."
After this i click OK and it closes everthing and leaves me staring at my background. I followed the file path in the error code and found libcef.dll but had no clue what to do from there, have been hunting for a solution for hours but cant find any.
 
Any help would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body: Any new ideas on this one? Ran into the same problem today (12/22/17). Run as Admin didn't help.
(28/12/2017) Having the same problem tried running with administrator privileges and still, the launcher gives an error. Please Help.

Hi guys,
I do have a similar problem my lol didn't patch so i decided to delete it and reinstall but when im npacking the files it got stuck in "Unpacking C:/Riot Gam[...]releases/installer/deploy/cef_100_percentage.pak" and my lol instaler isn't answering.
I run the steps in the permissions guide and searched in plenty of lol forums but anything worked.

Later i tryed to install hextech repair tool but it says "libcef.dll" doesn't exist so i can't start it.
I also realised that the file that the installer gets stuck ("Unpacking C:/Riot Gam[...]releases/installer/deploy/cef_100_percentage.pak",for example)  variates every time i launch the installer. I don't get why that happens
If u could help it would be apreciated,

If that installer is having problems unpacking certain files, it's most likely due to your OS lacking certain admin settings to allow the installer to alter and access specific files and filepaths. Run through the steps in this [**permissions guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) and try that installer again.
